title: One word: Buggy
text:
It took me over a year to finally get my two homes (primary and vacation) working perfectly. Some wired units had to be replaced for failure to connect - may be my fault for mis-wirring. I'm giving them the benefit of doubt. I've bought range extenders. I've changed outdoor timers. I have my primary wired with lots of lamps and outdoor lights on a schedule. I have cameras to monitor my vacation home - which was a primary factor in my purchase. It took lots of tech support to get the cameras operating correctly for remote viewing, but when working they were great.

Lots of upfront cost, BUT I prefer that over monthly fees some systems require. I don't like the fact that I can't have more than one schedule to come on at sunset - everything that turns on at sunset must go off at the same time.

Now I go on vacation and I can't connect. My lake house alarm goes off and my alarm app tells me it's a motion sensor. Insteon fails to connect and I can't see inside. I can't connect to anything. I get home and still can't connect. I can't even connect inside my primary residence. Frustrating is an understatement. Is this a result of the hubs planned - and then delayed - updated?

title: Getting better but missing some things

Update:
Please make some updates to the feature set of this app. Allow for multiple schedules per device or seen. Allow time flexibility within those schedules so it doesn’t look like a computer is turning the lights on and off every day.

I downgraded the rating because this app gets updated once a year and even then it’s not adding new features. Please start putting some development effort into the app and hub.

title: Would be 4-5 when they fix fatal flaw in App
text: Your iOS App has a fatal flaw; I am writing to hope that your developers can fix this problem. For those who have multiple sites under "House Management: Current House", you need to fix the app so that the user can chose the current house at startup. At the present, the app defaults to the last chosen Current House, and this leads to preventing the user from connecting to any of their Houses, if the last house chosen has lost power. In the event of a power failure, the App ALWAYS continues to connect to the house with no power when that was the last house chosen, which prevents the user to connecting to any house, as there is no way to get to the settings menu to allow the user to change to a house that has power, so the app becomes useless for any account that has multiple houses.  There needs to be a user choice at startup to allow the user to switch Current House settings in the event that the app cannot connect to the last setting, in the case that either the server cannot be reached for any reason: power outage, internet connection problems, etc... you get the point.

Everything is set up and managed via the ISY Admin Console on my Mac.  I don’t need to run every scene or set up any schedules when away from home, and it was no big deal to reprogram four scenes into this app.  This app runs the IO Link whereas the newer Insteon app does not, and this app works faultlessly across both my wife’s and my iPhones running the current iOS. title: Too basic and out of date
text:
The app is years behind the state of the art and the abilities that are available in competing products/apps. Insteon is not user friendly nor is it flexible, compatible with other systems, or capable of some basic type of programming. 

For example, you cannot use a sensor to turn on a light for 10 minutes (or any other duration). 

You cannot have two scenes (programs) that start at the same time (e.g., sunset). The app actually tells you to combine the scenes. That does a user no good, if the scenes are supposed to end at different times (or duration... if the app actually supported durations).

Insteon, please update the app and your hub to modern standards.

Follow-up: I tried using Alexa with the hub/app. That also barely works. Alexa shows notes that it cannot control scenes. Also, if you say, "Turn off the porch light," Alexa does not work, because it does not know it is a light. It only understands, "Turn off the porch."  It is a bit of a bigger deal with the garage door opener, because it is much more unnatural to say, "Turn on garage door" to open the garage. 

Insteon, please add interoperability with Wink.  Their hub is hardware agnostic and works well for programming different scenarios and works well with Alexa.

title: User(s) Error(s)???
text:
Based on reviews, I warily installed 12 switches last year to control a few 3-way switches and other lights in my living room, family room and kitchen. 

Installation was fairly easy and the one problem I had was very adeptly handled by Insteon support team. 

I put the switches into several scenes and onto sunrise/sunset timers and everything  performed flawlessly for the last 14 months.

Now I'm in a bit deeper. Over the last few days, I swapped out 74 more switches and added a few dimmer modules and four outdoor controllers for my landscape lights. I also added 20 leak detectors. 

I was incredibly pleased by the fact that not a single device failed to function properly during installation. They all communicated flawlessly with the Insteon Hub and are now assigned to their various rooms and scenes and behaving well. 

I find the iPhone app to be quite easy and intuitive to use. There are a few things I'd tweak if I were in charge, including allowing for more flexible scheduling, conditional events and allowing and offset to the sunset/sunrise times, but these are all "nice to haves" not "must haves". 

All my switches are the 2477D model. 

Alexa works perfectly after reworking my naming conventions to suit her demands (hint: if you have a three-way switch, name the primary switch, for example, "family floods" and switches two and three "fam flds 2" and "fam flds 3"). 

I'm a big fan of my Insteon setup, so am puzzled by all the negative reviews.  My guess is most of the reported problems are user errors.

The best thing about the app is the ability to see all of my lights and sensors in one place. In seconds I can tell if any lights were left on and if any doors are open. I can then turn off any lights that are on (open doors, unfortunately, can't be closed remotely 😊). 

Once the app is loaded up lights respond instantly which is a big improvement over other brands I've tried. 

Scheduling works great. I'm not sure why some people have trouble with it but mine is easy and flawless. My pool is on one timer and I have various lights on other timers. Especially useful is having the ability to have lights set to turn on at sunset and off at sunrise. 

All that said, the app isn't perfect. It can take a good fifteen to thirty or more seconds to start up. That means you never just pull out you iPhone to turn on/off a nearby light. It's great for checking all lights but not so great individually. 

Also, the layout is a bit cumbersome what with devices, rooms and scenes and then having status vs edit in different places. Even now I almost always go to the wrong place to edit a device. 

All told, however, I'm very pleased with the app.

title: Great hardware; immature software
text:
Insteon's dual-band (plc + radio) mesh networking capability is the most robust home automation protocol on the market today (short of native RESTful ip implementations yet to emerge).

But it's held back by software such as this app. Consider:
1) There's not a way to back up / restore your entire house's configuration - not on the hub, not offline. If a lighting strike messes it up (which happened to me, even though I have a whole-house surge suppressor installed), you need to reset everything and start from scratch. From scratch!
2) There's no officially supported synchrony among configurations done via this app / hub, in the House Link desktop application, and locally on the devices. Unofficially there's evidence of engineering bias to push whatever capability the switches/devices can support by themselves, onto them - which is good as it minimizes a single point of failure / bottleneck. But you can't officially have a clear view yet if a particular scene or config resides in the device, in the hub, or in the software.
3) After the current update, this app consistently crashes in iOS6.1 right after the interface is populated from the house config and it begins reading device states.

title: Try Insteon+ app instead
text: When I could not get this app to work with my Insteon Hub Pro, I contacted tech support and they instructed me to use the Insteon+ app. I was also told to bypass the app completely when registering new switches/dimmers. To do that, press the button on the back of the hub until it beeps and a green light comes on. Then go to the device you want to pair and press it's pairing button until it beeps. Press the devices button again until it beeps and return to the hub and press it's button till it beeps twice. The hubs LED will turn green and then switch back to blue, indicating you were successful. The devices are now linked to each other. Not The best way to do things, but it works every time for me. text:
I have been using Insteon equipment for years, and the devices work well, and reliably. But I still have many old X-10 devices in use, especially outside devices for Holiday lights. Every now and then, Insteon comes through with an update that makes X-10 non-functional. They've done it again. 

No outgoing signal, either programmed or manual. No changing on/off times, no adding new devices; if you try, they all revert to address A1.

Come on, Insteon: fix this!

title: I agree, worthless
text: Just purchased the product from Costco. I agree it is worthless. I downloaded the app tried to configure the router and I could not. Tried resetting it, try different wall outlets, try different connections to my router to no avail. I did not want to spend 30 minutes on hold to speak with someone to see if we could fix it. I will wait to see if this app is upgraded before I return it to Costco.  I must say that the price was amazingly good for a router and two wall appliance modules but when I look to see what the cost of other ones are they appear more expensive. Must be like printers. Sell the printer cheap and the ink expensive.

title: Great products
text: I can't say how great the led bulb and the motion sensors are. I also have the camera, remote management made easy, the app walks you through setting up port forwarding on most major router manufactures. The app has worked flawlessly for me no crashes on a iPhone 4s and currently on a iPhone 6 both were running iOS 8.1.1. I would have been happy to pay for this app, five dollars for no crashes yes that's a no brainer.

title: Does really program the insteon system
text: I already have dozens of switches and keypads in my house programmed and linked .  Hub is fine but its a totally separate system which does not interact with the programming in the switches nor does it work with the keypads. So I would have to build and maintain a completely redundant and separate system on hub which does not make sense to me. Plus I cannot use hub to link or program the switches and keypads so it does not really help me program or control the insteon system I have. I did not really understand what it did but it's really just a new and separate way to control some of your insteon devices with your phone or pad.

title: Still logging out
text:
I actually had a decent run with the older version not logging me out and was able to control devices on my Apple watch. My wife had issues but now that we have both upgraded to this version it logs is out consistently rendering both the app and the watch app useless. Hope to see a fix soon. 
On the bright side there were other welcomed improvements just nothing good for the watch.

title: Great system
text:
Great device/app!  Besides controlling your Insteon devices, this app will also program them.  If you have a lot of Insteon devices, the Hub is indispensable to set everything up.  You need to make sure you do a factory reset on them first so that Hub knows all of the program settings.  The app will not change anything set outside the app.  

It is cool to see Nest support.  I hope they also add Ecobee wifi thermostat support.

title: Fails to connect after performing update!
text: After installing the update, App fails to authenticate and connect. I've been on the phone with support for hours over hours and still unable to get it to work. I'm able to go on the web and log into my account using their beta app, but no devices are there. It would be nice if you're able to use the beta app on the web to create and control your devices. Nice app if it worked. Needs another update.

title: Apple Watch fix
text: How about fixing the Apple Watch software to allow users to actually use their watches to control devices rather than having to log into your phone to do so. What is the point of launching the app on your watch, then having to find your phone, which you left somewhere in your house, just to control your devices. At that point, I'll just use the phone since I went thru all the trouble of finding it. Incredibly stupid guys, don't even bother marketing your Apple Watch version, it's useless. Thanks for the other pointless upgrade, control your Sonos speakers, I really needed that.

title: Problems saving login info, watch app is useless
text: This version of the app does not save login credential or session token on the phone, every time you open the app you will have to login again.  Since the Apple Watch App requires the main app to be logged in to work, this essentially render the watch app useless.  It's very easy to persist the login token, and it doesn't seem like SmartHome has tested their app before releasing.  It will take any experienced developer just a couple hours to fix.  The company probably outsourced their app and don't know what they are doing.  I guess my next smart home setup won't be insteon anymore.

title: Decent...
text: Biggest complaint is that it definitely needs to rotate for the iPad. Seriously, this is a huge drawback of the app. Also really wish it was possible to adjust the sensitivity of the Insteon camera motion detection from within the app rather than logging into the camera's web interface. The UI isn't the best or the most intuitive, but the app is very quick and responsive and adding / editing devices is a breeze. Also very cool how it links directly to the manuals for all the devices.

title: Awesome
text: I really like this app. Although two way audio does not work on the IP cam which is why I bought the cam is still a great product. I do wish that you could fit more icons for your devices on the front page of the app therefore not have an escrow through second page after page to get to your other items to control. If those two things were different I would've given it five stars.

title: Needs more color.
text: I like the app and the devices, but it could use more color than just blue and white. How about giving us some color icons for the devices? The little dot indicating when the device is on is confusing, since it's darker when on than when it's off. How about using a vertical bar to show brightness levels on dimmer switches? Use white or bright green, instead of dull blue. Use black color for off.

title: More bugs. They never fix this app
text:
Two versions ago I could connect over cellular. Now I need to be on my local wifi for anything to work.

***Figured out if you're using a static IP set it to DHCP then set it back to static IP. That'll update your external IP address which you can't update manually. Never had this issue before***

It's clear they either don't care or don't have the resources to fix this or the several other major bugs they've been ignoring. I won't be buying any more Insteon devices and I'll migrate onto a more supported product like SmartThings moving forward.

title: Support could be better
text: After calling support 4 times, spending hours to explain the bug that they have between this iOS app, insteon hub and the Morninglinc. They finally listened to me and went to test the combination and admitted that the iOS app has a bug that preventing unlocking the MI lock properly(double tap the "off" button will make the lock to be opened and lock back again within few seconds). Hope the new version will come soon.

title: Super simple and works!!!
text: I was able to install the app and get my first device working super quick. I was skeptical of this at first so I only bought the starter kit. I look forward to slowly upgrading.  The only reason I didn't give the 5 stars is because of the slightly annoying extra steps to coordinate it. It was not very difficult but it could be daunting to non-tech savvy people.

title: Great starter app, but...
text:
Really nice app for someone who's getting into the home automation kit. Also has plenty of custom features and schedules. Keep updating!

One thing that bugs me is the app randomly takes a long time to refresh device status, i.e., when I get home to use garage door opener or turn on a light. I often find myself waiting in front of the garage door for 20-30 seconds before device list refreshes and I can open door.

title: Terrible app - Needs a total rewrite!
text: Convoluted, confusing, appalling app. Appears to be more like a random collection of bolted together utilities than a cohesive device control environment. Setting up and managing device schedules is possibly the most convoluted. For example you cannot appear to merge device schedules into a scene or even figure out how to delete an unwanted schedule! Even simple fader control to totally "off" seems beyond either this app and/or the device - there is still residual current flowing when scheduled unless the device is explicitly told to be "off"!

title: Easy to use and very cool technology
text: I was given this as a gift and everything has been easy to install and use.  I feel a lot safer and in control of my surroundings even when I'm not home now.  The app is really easy and I have not had any issues with it.  Now that I have it I cannot believe I didn't know about it sooner.

title: Great app
text: This is a great app that just keeps getting better. I first installed Insteon devices in my home a couple years ago and have continued to add devices several times a year. They keep, updating the app and have made awesome improvements each time. Their investment in the app gives me the confidence to keep buying more Insteon products.

title: Useless!
text:
I have been an iPhone user since 2007 and have used countless apps! This is the first time I've ever felt compelled to write a review. This app hands down is the most useless app in the AppStore... Even more useless than the pocket therapist app... At least that one brought me some laughs! 

I have tried for the last 2 weeks to either A. Turn a light on... Or B. Turn one off with this app... It's hasn't worked.. Most of the time it takes 4-6 attempts to connect to the hub. After connecting to the hub(if it ever does) it cannot operate anything. 

This app did work at one point, but has been completely screwed up.

Let me close this by saying... I love Insteon products and I would recommend them to anyone  I know, with the exception of this app. It's an embarrassment to Insteon... Not to mention the money I wasted on the hub! 

Anyhow, I hope Insteon is able to fix this app!

title: Insteon product
text: Fantastic product! Installed extremely easy. Didn't have to read the instructions as the hub just took over and installed everything. Had a simple question for customer support and they called me back with the info! Extremely happy with the purchase.

title: Decent system
text: I've had an X10 system for over 30 years. Slowly I've been upgrading to Insteon. This a significant improvement over the old X10 but the price tag for switches and interfaces are higher. The Insteon Hub however is a huge convenience. Being able to check in from anywhere is great. The app does occasionally hang. I've had to delete and reinstall it a few times but over all it performs well.

title: iOS 8 update please
text: Still like the app just need an update, after updating my apple products to iOS 8 there seems to be at least a couple of issues. One being not able to change the name of a device, when trying to change the name the app crashes. Good stable app, not flashy and complicated, just basic and easy to use.

title: Starting to slow
text: This is great app for what it does but it's really starting to slow to the point of being almost unusable as a handheld controller. It can take 45sec+ to figure out the status of the various modules and display them. And if you move to another page of control a device, it starts polling all over again. Hopefully they can figure out how to speed this polling up a little

title: Apple Watch portion
text: The Apple Watch app looks great and I love the design but there is still a long way to go. I originally had posted that the watch app did not work but discovered that you have to launch or have recently launched the Insteon app from your phone. There is no feedback as to if a light is on or off or otherwise and I still can't get the camera to display through the watch. I think it is a good beta version but has a way to go still.

title: Terrible Design
text: Really poorly designed App. You can only have one scene mapped to the same starting time, like Sunset. Why can't two different scenes start at the same time, and end at different times? App makes it impossible to remove a start or end time, or just delete a schedule for a device. All you can do is change the time. INSTEON, please hire someone to do this and test it properly before selling the HUB which can only be accessed using this dumb App. The previous web app for Smartlinc was better than this, and that is not saying much.

title: Still not as good as X-10
text: In theory, Insteon should leave X-10 in the dust. In practice, Insteon is more difficult to set up, less customizable, the Hub rarely operates in the same time zone that I live in, this app is painful to use, and to top it off, every time the app updates, it deletes my email and password, making my iPhone useless to run Insteon until I go look up and reenter all my data. Style does NOT beat substance. I'm really missing the usefulness and customizability of X-10.

title: Great app (for sending them data)
text: I tried the insteon hub and app, setup was easy and I liked the camera interface but their hub uses an external web service which means all of your home automation data is being sent through their servers. I have since trashed their device since their is no good reason that they should be privy to this data. Home automation devices should not rely on outside web services, period.

title: Install was easy
text:
I already had a bunch of Insteon devices installed.  
I got a Hub and then started adding devices through the app.  
It was easy to add the devices, just follow the steps in the app.
Once I had a number of devices in the app, it was really easy to create scenes.
I just had to click on the devices I wanted in the scene and the app pretty much did the rest.

title: Disappointed
text: Before I bought the hub I used a 3rd party app and was able to use the 2 way audio and zoom. I got the hub with excitement because the insteon app is supposed to be better. HUGE DISAPPOINTMENT!!! No zoom and no 2 way audio. Only benefit is I can see whats going on using cellular instead of wifi. I need lots more items but may choose another brand if this cant be fixed soon.

title: works well with all insteon hardware
text: My only complaint is that SmartHome decided to change the thermostat access module.  It is very difficult to use with the slider.  It would be much better if they went back to the old thermostat where one could hit up or down arrows to change the temperature.  I would have given this app a '4 Star' if it hadn't been for the thermostat. Please fix the thermostat.

title: Excellent...And getting better and better!
text:
I think INSTEON is the best company when we talk about home automation. 
If you are new in this and you're trying to find the right supplier,think in INSTEON,thry have the hardware,software and attention.

Now,when you are going to release the new version for the new HUB?

title: Good start!
text:
The app, and the hub/cloud, is a very start for home automation.   

I would really like to see some form of offline management.   If your home internet service is out, you can't control any of your devices.  Even if you are in the same room, the app is hard coded to communicate with your devices via the Internet.

title: Better
text:
This new version of the app is a big improvement over previous releases. 
I was hoping for more some functionality after waiting almost 2 months for an update, but this version seems faster and my camera loads a lot quicker.  Haven't seen any crashes yet.

title: Poorly designed
text: I don't understand all the positive reviews. This gives you the ability to control, but the interface is ridiculously poor. Very not intuitive, very hard to find many varied settings. Doing something as simple as setting a schedule to disable the controller is amazingly difficult. For a first release app from a developer that doesn't know anything about iOS, this isn't very bad. But for an app that several years old? This is stunningly badly designed.

title: PLEASE FIX THIS APP!!!!!!!!!!!
text: This is incredibly frustrating that this new update has made the entire app useless. I cannot turn anything on from it anymore, none of my timers will work and now I can't even simply turn lights on from the Insteon light switches without doing a hard reset... seriously I can't even turn on a light anymore. I spent several hundreds of dollars on this and its installation and now it doesn't even work. PLEASE FIX THIS!!!!! Or at least offer a chance to load the old app

title: Logging in issues
text: I have insteon systems in three locations. When I launch the app it doesn't show which of my 3 locations I am logging into. I cannot determine the location I am loging into until I connect to the hub. Why not add the ability before logging in to choose a location. If a hub cannot be accessed then you cannot log onto other locations.

title: Removing more functionality...
text: I want this to work independently from the internet, you know, off the grid. Each version of the hub and app seems to remove functionality I once enjoyed. This version removes adding a device by id. Sometimes I just want to write the ids down, install the switches and add them later instead of running around the house. Now I can't. Stop removing features or releasing buggy software.

title: Broken Apple watch app
text:
Don't update! This version still logs you out of your iPhone when using the apple watch app and the iPhone app isn't open. Unlike the older version you could use the back button and log back in. This version clears your credentials all together! 

The apple watch app would be such a great app if it would work right! It's been broken since they released it, and I keep waiting on a fix for it. Still waiting after this version too!

title: Works perfect
text: Love the updates. Keep them coming! Everything works as stated. I have 6 scenes set up and 14 devices at home. All work like they should. Not one complaint. Works well on both iPhone and IPad. Not sure why others are having such issues.

title: Works, but lacks features
text: The app works well and is reliable.  However it lacks very basic features like allowing offsets (ex. turn lights on 30 minutes before sunset or vary turn off time slightly for security). These are very basic things - X10 did this 20 years ago!  While I love the Insteon technology for its reliability, the software needs work to be more than flashy "scenes".

title: Fixed last issue.
text:
I removed my last 1 star because they fixed the issue but more importantly they owned up to the issue and said sorry (stuff breaks, got it, but you need to own it).

They app is getting better. Still too slow.

The Insteon system however is still the best of you want end to end home automation.

title: Doesn't work most of the time
text:
It takes several minutes to recognize even a few Insteon devices and then, after it recognizes them, only works a small fraction of the time.  When you find that you can save considerable time by walking over to the light switch and turning it on manually, the old-fashioned way, you know that the remote control app you're using is bad.  

This app is a waste if time, and the hub it required a waste of money.

title: 3 hrs trying to install camera
text: There are no words to describe just how frustrated I have become in trying to install this system into my iPhone. I followed the directions to the T and my phone could never found the camera. It did not matter if I tried every which way from Sunday it absolutely would not work. I'm not even going to bother trying to install the door sensor or worse yet the thermostat. Forget it! I give up and am returning the product disgusted.

title: It works but FAR from easy set-up
text: Used this with their "hub" to build a basic water leak system. I've been able to get a motorized valve to work with one leak sensor (after MUCH trial and error). No luck yet in adding additional sensors or one of their remote switches. I can also turn the valve on/off via iPhone. Instructions and web support very weak. Go this route only if you don't mind fiddling -- it is NOT plug and play.

title: LOVE THIS APP
text:
I use this app from all over the world. I have cameras, thermostat, lights and Sonos (need more help here though - otherwise I would have given it 5 stars). App works flawlessly and do not understand how other people are having problems. 

I am about to set up my garage door opener, motion detectors and front door lock with it as well. 

The cameras are the best! I can talk to my kids through the cameras and help them out at home and make sure everything is ok. 

I would have everyone buy the products and free app. Also, contacting Insteon is easy and extremely helpful. 

Have fun IoT!

title: Functions ok, but is Ugly
text:
The app does what it is supposed to do, it turns on and off devices and created scenes. 

However, I find the menu structuring to be not very intuitive. Getting from devices to scenes and back is awkward.  

Finally, the graphics are just awful they remind me of 1999. Can we get some more modern theming and iconography?  I know you are capable because the app for the HomeKit-enabled hub looks a bit better.

title: Fair
text: After a hard time getting this bird up off the ground it is flying pretty well now.  Tech support was needed. Once they worked the bugs out of account creation adding devices was smooth and effortless.  The ability to do things that I had presumed would be possible may in fact not be.  I'll update as time goes on.

title: Unreliable
text: Just like their other insteon devices, it's unreliable. Need better quality management. I replaced whole home with insteon devices and lots of them failed. The hub application has dependency on their server, they're sever fail which i seemed to experience, means you can't login to your hub. Now that happened, i see that lots of complain about how they may gather your usage information. Think twice before adopting them. The hub is going back.

title: When will the Today screen be utilized?
text: It's such an inconvenience to have to open the app each time I want to access my favorites. Cant you implement quick access buttons to scenes and devices from my favorites on the Today screen in the pull down notification area? I know the Universal Devices app has been doing it for the longest time when using the iSY hub. Come on, Insteon.

title: Works Great - need badge notifications
text: This is great app so far and has been handy to use on indoor and outdoor lighting. One feature lacking would be a badge icon to indicate a light is on or the number of items turned on currently.

title: Now I couldn't connect to my hub on the cellular!!
text: I used to be able to connect and control my hub from away from home via cellular connection.  After couple app updates including this latest updates, now I couldn't.  It also seems to hung up on the Apple Watch app as well and don't work as good as before.  Just bought this Insteon Hub kits from Costco and it is a bargain but now, returning it is the next option.  Please fix you app a.s.a.p.

title: Need to start over
text: It's time to scrap this app and start over. I use it to add devices and that's about it. 3rd party apps are faster and have more features. Maybe that's the point, but insteon, at least open the API for all of your devices if you guys choose to try to spend development time on this inherently poor app. It's not to late to start over and come out with a modern mobile app.

title: Getting better
text: The latest version connects to the hub fast!  And no more slow statuses from devices. Hooray! Now if you'd only create a notification widget so I could get to the controls faster. Can't wait for the HomeKit enabled hub.

title: Insteon App
text: Lacks basic features. Appears like a high school project and not like a professionally written app for a device costing $130. Very disappointing. I keep waiting for an improved version with obviously required improvements but I have not seen anything in many months. I have been using insteon products for several years now and the Hub and it's app have been a complete disaster from the beginning. Looks like the company has lost it's way and is headed south.

title: Cool!!
text: Way better than the Smartlinc app. With the latest update, this app is getting to be the best of home automation. I just wish that it can support the EZFlora so i can totally get rid of my Smartlinc. Or add the option of creating events so I can send custom commands to the EZFlora.

title: Like the system but...
text: The last update broke the ability to turn on at sunset.  I have now lost one of the main functions I used it for.  Not sure if a fix is planned but it's frustrating that an update that does one thing breaks something else.

title: Can't control via app
text: Wish I could give it zero stars. At first I was able to control the thermostat via my app over cellular connection now I cannot. The whole reason I bought Insteon was for this purpose now I am just wasting money heating my business after my employees for nothing.  Very upset! I find I can do it while I'm connected to Wi-Fi but that is it. Big fat waste! This is the first app review I've ever written that how upset I am- Shame on you Insteon!

title: Round,round,round,round it goes.
text: I NEVER leave reviews but this app is so frustrating I just had too. Every time we open it to turn on or off the lights plugged into the devices it just stares at us with that annoying circle going round and round and round and round.....  Restart app, start all over. It's not like our phones or internet equipment is old. iPhones 6s & 7. Latest Uverse gateway and fast internet. Please fix or it's all going back to the store.

title: not done yet
text:
It's missing tons of feature, including basic ones like being able to edit the favorites (right now every device is automatically added to favorites and cannot be deleted.

There is also no way to set triggers, so while you can set up a scene, you cannot tie it to any controller other than this app.

title: Coyote
text: This is a good app & easy to set up and use. I turn lights on, off, dim no matter where I am. It has always been dependable. I am little by little adding more to my network & the Insteon app makes it easy. Thanks.

title: So much potential
text: When you think of what could be done with insteon devices and a good hub / application you can't help but to see all the missed opportunities.  I would not recommend insteon devices to anyone if they are starting from scratch - I have an existing investment so I am stuck for now.  App is a huge disappointment.

title: Slow and clumsy interface
text: I generally like my insteon system, but this app needs professional help.  The UX is not that helpful, and hamburger menus for everything make it hard to navigate.  If I could only ask for one thing, it would be to add a cancel/skip button when programming cant find a device.

title: Hub 2 installation failure
text: Hub 2 could not be installed using the app. I spent hours trying myself and 70 min with tech support. The app kept losing connection to the hub during the verification step of the automatic firmware update. Waiting for a replacement hub and will report hopefully soon whether this was a problem with the specific device I was shipped or is a systemic issue. I was told bugs like this are to be expected with new products. What a business philosophy....

title: Worst piece of crap ever
text: This device and software seem to be the product of a high-school computer class. You have to watch a video every time you add a device. There is no direct access to device settings at the detailed level. For example, I just added a camera. It was a wansview brand, not Smarthome's rebranded version. The software found the device and I'm able to view. However it couldn't identify the model so I can't pan and tilt.

title: Great app. Never fails.
text: I’m going 5 stars on this. I’ve been using it for almost a year and have never had any problems. It seems like it could get some updates but I’m very happy with it regardless.

title: Poorly designed, buggy.
text: I started using this app 2 months ago and found it to be very user-UNFRIENDLY and difficult to set up.  After not using for several weeks, I tried using it only to find it’s forgotten my email address and password.  If I indicate I’ve “Forgot” my password and then enter my email address in order to re-set it, I get the response: “Account Doesn’t Exist”!  Now I seem to be faced with setting up a new account.  What a PITB!

title: limited X10 support
text:
This app will not allow you to schedule more than one x10 device to turn on or off at sunrise/sunset.

The problem is that the combination of the app and the Hub only allows one device to be schedule for a specific time.  Sunrise/sunset counts as one time!  The work around is to us a “scene”, but the software does not support X10 devices in scenes, only Insteon devices.

This is less functionality than the older Smartlinc device and app.

title: Desperately needs encryption!
text:
The developer refuses to encrypt communication over the Internet.  Data is wide open to those that know how to 'sniff' it.  You logins and passwords are unprotected without common protocols like SSL (https:) and others.  

Make sure you at least change your default passwords, and careful what you automate - who knows who might be watching...

title: Reliable App
text: I have no problem logging in locally or remotely into my hub to control my 20+ switches. I wish that app had more scheduling options, but it does work well for checking the status and turning things on and off.

title: Room for improvement
text: Better than nothing; however, could easily be improved.  For example: avoid starting with login screen every time and allow thermostat high/low levels to be controlled independently without having to switch between modes.

title: X10 still supported but takes extra step
text:
I don't like the update from March 20, x10 modules still supported but require you to first push the + sign below the on off, then press the on off that appears after you push the plus sign.
The old app was better, for those of us that have x10 products and bought insteon for that reason.
I guess we have to remember that this is an insteon product and not x10.

title: OMGosh!!!  Apple Watch Issues
text:
I'm extremely disappointed. It's like they are completely ignoring that there are integration issues with the Apple Watch. I would be more than happy to loan my 17-year-old son who writes iOS apps to help you fix this problem. How hard can it be?

I have more than 30 Insteon devices in my house that are rendered useless to me without this integration working properly. Please fix this.

title: Scenes don’t work
text: I added devices simple enough and can control them manually. But I try to add a scene to turn on/off a device (a wired light switch) at a certain time, go through all the steps and save it, but then the scene doesn’t appear under scenes. Plus, the portrait and landscapes modes are a mess. Half the time the dialogs appear up side down. Very rough app.

title: Nice update
text:
The app is now a pleasure to use. Setting up devices are perfect now. 

Schedule scenes are working flawlessly now.  Thank you.  

If they can fix their other Insteon+ app for homekit is another story.

title: Cool app
text: I find this app useful for our home monitoring. Very reliable. We don't have to even pay any monthly fee for this reliable system. I hope they support iPhone home kit soon.

title: Far from perfect
text: Problematic at best. Works ok with WiFi connection but doesn't work at all over cell phone signal. Hub only works with gadgets that are a few feet away. Anything past 25 feet and the hub doesn't read anything. Insteon has a great idea but I think they need to wait a year or two so they can catch up with current technology.

title: Still needs work
text: Not thrilled with this version... I was running the beta version (1.3.11) as a tester and am stilling running the beta! V1.4 is slow and keeps popping up with connecting to hub error messages.  Overall I love the hub and having everything all in one place- able to control my house from anywhere ... Even in bed!

title: Needs iPad landscape mode
text: In general the app works well enough but I desperately want it to have landscape capability at the very least on the iPad.  Like I have seen others mention I too have an iPad wall mounted for home control and this app's lack of landscape capability makes it difficult to use in comparison to every other home auto app I use.

title: Pretty Solid
text: The only gripe I have is that you it doesn't have auto log in.  It would be nice to have the option to do auto log-ins for those who want it.  Personally I hate entering my email and password each time.

title: This App Works Well - What am I missing?
text: I was braced for a terrible app experience based on the previous reviews… But I plugged everything together and it worked perfectly.

title: Completely broken
text:
I wish I'd read the reviews of the latest release and stopped the update.  Ugh!!!!  None of my X10 devices are controllable from the app now.

Update 3/23:

title: It's a start
text:
I have just begun using this application to schedule security type lighting.   I had been using similar software in the past (X10). Best thing this software provides for me is the capability to monitor and/or change lighting remotely.  However, I am not sure how the system recovers from a power outage.  I suspect that it is able to recover your settings via internet connection to your account but it is not clear how that will affect scheduled lighting (e.g., will the system turn on a light that would have already been on if there was no power outage).

The software has a limitation that only allows one device or scene to be schedule to go on or off at a particular time.   It does include the capability to schedule for sunset / sunrise but there is no capability to adjust the calculated sunset / sunrise times to have your security lighting appear more natural (keep from having all/many of your lights going on / off at once).  There is capability to create scenes where you can group devices or setup manual on/off times but these times would have to be manually  adjusted coincide with the changing length of day/night hours. 

Hopefully, this application will get better as times goes on.  I have included a list below of some capabilities I wish it included now or in the future.

Be able to create schedules at the device level (sunset / sunrise), including ability to offset the calculated on/off time to make lighting appear more natural / lived-in.
Rearrange icons on Favorites or Room screens to make it easier to use.  It appears the icons are being arranged in alphabetical order only.
Would be nice to have separate Edit selections for each type of thing (Favorites, Devices, Scenes).   Currently there is only one Edit selection pointing to one of the types.  You have to select a different type before you can Edit it.  I understand this now but it was confusing when I first started.

It seems that the modules need to have power all the time in order to connect to your Wi-Fi and the LEDs pick up on that and will power themselves on and cannot be turned completely off as long as that power source is there. Big big disappointment! It says nothing on the box about this issue although Support says it's a known issue.
